title: 9 hairstyles for every holiday mood
author: Jayesha Khan
excerpt:
Life is all about balance. Sweatpants on the bottom and great hair on top, a healthy meal and a sweet treat after, or a sweaty home workout sesh followed by a lazy day, it‚Äôs all about finding the right balance to help maintain a sense of normalcy this holiday season. That goes for holiday looks too‚Äîthis holiday season, the theme is cute but comfy, finding looks to carry you all the way through from movie-marathons to spontaneous holiday Zoom parties.

This year‚Äôs holidays look a little (read: a lot different). While it has been a year of ups and downs and unpredictability, if you‚Äôre like us, you‚Äôve been through every mood in the book. There may not be large holiday parties to get glammed up for, but you can still play with your look to suit your different moods this holi-stay season.


1. When you feel like dressing up on the couch

Sport to dress up and go to the only place we want to go this holiday season‚Äîthe couch. Whether you are hitting the couch for a wine-filled holiday Zoom hang, a holiday movie marathon, or for some R&R after a day of baking cookies, your soft waves will have you feeling fun, flirty, and fierce. 

We love iconic blogger Sasha Exeter's loose waves with a classic middle part and Olivia's crochet headband to tie the look together. 

Tip: Use the to achieve any the perfect loose wave.


2. When you‚Äôre over it

Nothing says ‚Äúover it but loving it‚Äù quite like piling all of your hair on the top of your head in a massive bun.

What do you do when you reach the point where you‚Äôre just over it all? Throw your hair up in a bun. can be as sleek, chic, or messy ‚Äî as low or high maintenance as you want. 

Throwing your hair up in a bun is the perfect solution for when you have second-day hair or your locks just aren‚Äôt doing what you want them to do. Truthfully buns are the ideal #wfh or #hfh (holiday from home) look because they help you keep your hair out of your face and require minimal time and effort.

Tip: Elevate your bun with a hair accessory like a, or.


3. When you're feeling the love

Romantic updo with side braid

Did your significant other just surprise you with the news that they are bringing home fancy takeout or ingredients for a delicious home cooked meal? Sounds like you have a date night you didn‚Äôt quite prepare for. The good thing is that, with an updo, you can worry less about your hair and spend more time looking forward to the spontaneous treat.

Updos are pretty and elegant, but they can also be casual or edgy‚Äîit all depends how you accessorize and complete the look. The best part about is that they look great and can be done in no time at all. 

Tip: Add a braid down the side or finish off the look with a sultry hair accessory for late night fun with your SO. 


4. When you just want to watch The Grinch in Christmas pajamas

Is there anything better than snuggling up on the couch with a cozy blanket while the snow falls silently outside? We didn't think so. Nothing says Christmas spirit quite , and candy canes‚Äîcomplete with a couple of cute pigtails, of course. 

We love the look of these long sleek pigtails, using two clip-in to add instant length volume.

Tip: Elevate your pigtails by styling the two pieces; braid them, add different sections...get creative!

title: Bridal Makeup Trends 2025
author: Sarita Shah
excerpt:
Bridal Makeup Trends 2025

1. ‚ú® Minimal Glass-Skin Look

  • Fresh, glowing, healthy skin finishes are trending.
  • Skin tints and lightweight foundations are popular.
  • Soft liquid highlighters add glow without greasiness.

2. üíÑ Soft Nude & Peachy Tones

  • Perfect for brides seeking subtle elegance.
  • Beautiful with pastel outfits and floral jewellery.

3. üëÅÔ∏è Brown Smokey Eyes

  • Softer and more romantic than black smokey eyes.
  • Ideal for evening functions like sangeet.

4. üí´ Feathered, Natural Brows

  • Full, soft brows are in.
  • Soap brows and brow gels give a natural lift.

5. üíã Bold Statement Lips

  • Plum, wine, and berry shades dominate.
  • Velvet-matte finishes give a luxe look without dryness.

6. üå∏ Pastel Eye Makeup

  • Pinks, lilacs, and peaches for soft daytime looks.
  • Great for haldi and mehendi.

7. ü™∑ Soft Shimmer & Foiled Eyes

  • Champagne and rose-gold metallics are trending.
  • Perfect for night functions.

8. üåô Underpainting / Soft Sculpting

  • Blush and contour applied before foundation.
  • Gives natural dimension without heaviness.

9. üíé Pearl, Stone & Crystal Accents

  • Perfect for Insta-worthy bridal looks.
  • Great for mehendi and sangeet events.

10. üíñ Monochromatic Makeup Look

  • Using one color across eyes, cheeks, and lips.
  • Shades like rose, coral, and mauve are popular.

title: How to Choose the Right Haircut
author: Priya Shah
excerpt: Choosing the right haircut can transform your look. Here are tips to find the perfect style for your face shape.
content:
How to Choose the Right Haircut ‚Äì Step-by-Step Guide

1. Identify Your Face Shape
Check whether your face is oval, round, square, heart, or long.
Each shape suits different styles ‚Äî for example, layers for round faces, soft waves for square faces, and bobs for oval faces.

2. Understand Your Hair Texture
Know whether your hair is straight, wavy, curly, or coily.
Some cuts work best on certain textures ‚Äî e.g., blunt cuts for straight hair, layers for wavy/curly hair.

3. Check Your Hair Density (Thickness)
Determine if your hair is thin, medium, or thick.
Thin hair needs volume-adding cuts; thick hair benefits from structured or layered cuts.

4. Consider Your Lifestyle
Pick a style that matches your daily routine.
If you have a busy schedule, choose low-maintenance cuts; if you enjoy styling, layered or textured cuts work well.

5. Think About Your Maintenance Level
Some cuts require regular trims (like bobs or bangs).
Decide how often you're willing to visit the salon.

6. Choose a Cut That Matches Your Personal Style
Classic, modern, bold, elegant ‚Äî select a haircut that reflects your personality.
Short pixies for bold looks, soft waves for feminine styles, sleek bobs for professional appeal.

7. Consider Your Hair Goals
Are you trying to grow your hair, add volume, or reduce weight?
Different cuts help achieve different goals ‚Äî e.g., long layers help growing hair look stylish.

8. Discuss With a Professional Stylist
Share your face shape, hair issues, and expectations.
A stylist can suggest what truly suits you based on professional judgment.

9. Try Virtual Haircut Tools (Optional)
Apps allow you to preview styles on your photo.
Helps reduce confusion and boosts confidence before cutting.

10. Start With a Safe Version (If Unsure)
If you‚Äôre nervous, choose a softer or slightly longer version of the style.
You can always cut more later, but you cannot undo overcuts.

title: Waxing vs. Shaving: Pros and Cons
author: Priya Shah
excerpt:
The choice between these two hair removal methods is driven by the desired balance between convenience, cost, and the duration of results.

Waxing

  • Longevity of Results: Extended Smoothness (3-6 weeks) due to hair removal from the root.
  • Hair Regrowth: Finer and Sparser over time as the follicle is potentially weakened.
  • Skin Impact: Exfoliation Benefit (removes dead skin cells), but high risk of temporary pain and redness/inflammation.
  • Convenience: Low frequency of maintenance required, but mandates a regrowth period before treatment.
  • Cost: Higher initial and recurring expense (especially for professional services).

Shaving

  • Longevity of Results: Very Short-Term (1-3 days) as hair is only cut at the surface.
  • Hair Regrowth: Coarser and more noticeable stubble due to the blunt cut.
  • Skin Impact: Painless procedure, but high risk of nicks, cuts, razor burn, and chronic irritation.
  • Convenience: High accessibility and quick integration into daily routines, but requires very high frequency of maintenance.
  • Cost: Low initial and recurring expense.

title: The Art of Everyday Makeup
author: Priyanka Shah
excerpt: Master the basics of everyday makeup with these simple tips and tricks for a flawless look.
content:
The Areas of Everyday Makeup ‚Äì Detailed Points

1. Base Makeup (Foundation Area)

  • Creates an even skin tone for a clean everyday look.

  • Includes primer, BB/CC cream, or lightweight foundation.

  • Helps smooth texture, blur pores, and prepare skin for other products.

2. Concealer Area (Under-Eyes & Spots)

  • Applied under the eyes to reduce dark circles and tiredness.

  • Used on blemishes, acne marks, and pigmentation for a natural finish.

  • Brightens the center of the face for a fresh appearance.

3. Eyebrows Area

  • Light filling or shaping gives structure to the face.

  • Soft brow pencil or brow gel keeps the look natural.

  • Defines facial expressions without looking heavy.

4. Eye Makeup Area (Lids & Lash Line)

  • Everyday look usually includes neutral eyeshadow or no eyeshadow at all.

  • A thin liner enhances eye shape without making it dramatic.

  • Mascara opens up the eyes and adds definition.

5. Cheeks Area (Blush & Light Contour)

  • Blush adds natural color and freshness to the face.

  • Soft contour or bronzer offers subtle dimension.

  • Cream or powder based on skin type.

6. Lips Area

  • Tinted lip balm, nude lipstick, or gloss keeps lips hydrated and fresh.

  • Neutral tones match everyday outfits and work environments.

  • Adds balance to the overall makeup look.

7. Highlight Area (High Points of the Face)

  • Applied to cheekbones, brow bones, and nose bridge.

  • Gives a soft glow without looking too shiny.

  • Ideal for fresh, natural everyday radiance.

8. Setting Area (Powder or Spray)

  • Light setting powder helps control oil in the T-zone.

  • Setting spray locks the makeup for long hours.

  • Keeps everyday makeup consistent throughout the day.

9. Skincare Prep Area (Before Makeup)

  • Cleanser, moisturizer, and sunscreen are essential.

  • Prepares skin so makeup applies smoothly and lasts longer.

  • Creates a healthy base that boosts the final makeup look.
